hedline.hl1: A Place to Go When There's a Whole Lotta Shakin' Goin' On

abstract.p: Dr David Wald, seismologist at US Geological Survey, maintains Web site at which people answer a list of questions after an earthquake and give their ZIP code, thus providing a gauge of a quake's intensity and damage over its entire range; photo (M)

block.p: WHEN an earthquake roused tens of thousands of Northern California residents from their sleep early in the morning on Sept. 3, hundreds of those rattled souls went straight to their computers and logged onto the Internet.

First, many people checked the United States Geological Survey's Web site (quake .wr.usgs.gov/recenteqs) for the magnitude (5.2) and epicenter (near the town of Yountville, in Napa County), which were calculated within minutes by seismic instruments and posted automatically to the site.
